Description: Clay tablet-case; real estate sale; seals; Old Babylonian; in eight pieces; most of pieces are partially repaired from smaller fragments.
Bibliographic references: Leichty E et al 1988a / Catalogue of the Babylonian Tablets in the British Museum, volume VIII: Tablets from Sippar 3 (p.146)
Condition: Incomplete; in eight pieces; most of pieces are partially repaired from smaller fragments. --------------------------------------------------------------------------- 24/11/09 - Found to compromise the main body, four very large fragments, previously joined (?), five smaller text fragments, and many smaller fragments.
Acquisition name: From: Sir Ernest A T Wallis Budge
Acquisition notes: Acquired by the British Museum as a result of Budge's second mission to Egypt and Mesopotamia in 1887-1888; the mission was intended to investigate the "leakage" of tablets from sites supposedly guarded on behalf of the British Museum. Further notes on acquisition and bibliographic references relating to acquisition in catalogue introduction pp.xv-xvii.
